description: System-generated unique identifier for a single repair request record in the fleet maintenance system. Used to link the request to assets, schedules, work orders, and billing.

Human-readable description of the service item selected or entered via the portal for this request. Typically sourced from a controlled list to guide technicians and billing; confirm whether free-text is allowed.
Reference to a coded reason explaining why the repair is needed. Foreign key to a reason lookup (symptom, failure, compliance); exact code set may vary—confirm with SME.

Reference to a standardized code combining group/system, component, and action to be performed. Supports labor estimation, parts mapping, and analytics; likely a foreign key to a repair taxonomy table—confirm with SME.
Boolean flag indicating whether this request’s costs are chargeable to a customer or internal cost center. Drives invoicing, budgeting, and cost allocation rules.

Identifier linking the request to its associated maintenance schedule or appointment. Foreign key to scheduling data; confirm whether it points to a preventive maintenance plan, campaign, or specific calendar event.

Flag indicating the record is deprecated or inactive and should no longer be used in current processing. Used to hide or lock the request; confirm whether it denotes cancellation or historical archival.
